interestingFact: Japan is home to more than 6,800 islands.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Brazil is the only country in South America where Portuguese is the official language.
India is the largest democracy in the world.
Australia is the only continent covered by a single country.
Germany is home to over 20,000 castles.
Kenya is known as the cradle of humanity due to many early human fossils found there.
Egypt is home to one of the world’s oldest civilizations, dating back over 5,000 years.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
Norway is home to the Svalbard Global Seed Vault, a storage facility for seeds to protect global crop diversity.
